meanings.definition: An organism that lives on or in a host organism and gets its food from or at the expense of the host.
meanings.sent1: The parasite attached itself to the dog and started feeding off it.
meanings.sent2: The farmer sprayed the crops to get rid of the harmful parasite.
meanings.sent3: The parasite thought it was clever to mooch off the host without doing any work.
meanings.sent4: The parasite of laziness slowly drained the energy of the hardworking ants.
meanings.sent5: The parasite clung to the tree, draining its nutrients and weakening it.

meanings.definition: A person who habitually relies on or exploits others and gives nothing in return.
meanings.sent1: The office parasite always took credit for other people's work.
meanings.sent2: She realized her so-called friend was actually a social parasite.
meanings.sent3: The party parasite showed up only for free food and drinks.
meanings.sent4: His parasitic behavior drained the team's morale and productivity.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the emotional parasite who feeds on your kindness and empathy.
